meanings.definition: The state of being excessively concerned with one's health.
meanings.sent1: Her constant worry about every little ache and pain showed her valetudinarianisms.
meanings.sent2: His valetudinarianisms led him to visit the doctor multiple times a week.
meanings.sent3: Despite his valetudinarianisms, he still enjoyed going for walks in the park.
meanings.sent4: The valetudinarianisms of the character in the play added a comedic touch to the story.
meanings.sent5: The grandmother's valetudinarianisms were so extreme that she carried a thermometer everywhere she went.

meanings.definition: The beliefs or practices of a person excessively concerned with their health.
meanings.sent1: The new age guru's valetudinarianisms included daily meditation and herbal remedies.
meanings.sent2: She found comfort in the valetudinarianisms of holistic healing.
meanings.sent3: His valetudinarianisms extended to only eating organic foods and practicing yoga.
meanings.sent4: The valetudinarianisms of the health-conscious community were evident in their strict dietary choices.
meanings.sent5: The valetudinarianisms of the fitness influencer inspired many to prioritize their well-being.
